page.description: Returns the current time on the system clock in the fomat 'HH:MM:SS', optional format controls other times, passed in time type can be used in place of the current time.
page.syntax: Formatted_Date_Time as C = TIME([C time_format[,T time])

argument.name: time_format
argument.description: Optional. Default = "0h:0m:0s". A time format created according to the rules of Date and Time Format Elements.

argument.name: time
argument.description: Default = NOW(). A time value to format. Optional

page.discussion: TIME() returns a date time value containing a formatted Date Time value. If time_format is not specified, the time is returned in the format HH:MM:SS. The system time is obtained from the system clock (which can be set from DOS). For information on performing time arithmetic, see the TOSECONDS()and TOTIME()functions. The optional time_format parameter allows you to create custom date and time formats.

section.description: Converting a Time value to a Character value:
section.example: time("", now() ) -> returns the current date time without any special formatting (e.g. "02/04/199910:37:37 63 am") time("0h-0m-0s.2", t1) -> returns the value in t1, formatted as specified (e.g. "10-42-16.63")
